Reviews.Title: “Convenient location to metro, restaurants and Champs Elysees”
Reviews.Author: ianatbragg
Reviews.Content: Cheapest hotel we could find in the area. Argentine metro stop was in front of the hotel. We landed at Paris Beauvais-Tille airport from Madrid (Ryanair) and a 45min shuttle bus took us to Porte Maillot, Paris. It was only a 10min walk to the hotel from there. The rooms were small and had no air conditioning or ventilation. Our room was #114 facing the street. If you opened the windows, you would not be able to sleep at night due to traffic noise and the cigarette smell from the restaurant in front. The bed was comfortable and the toilets were clean though cramped. TV was small and no english channels. The room had a small fridge. If you don't mind the accommodations which we really didn't because it was just a place to rest up for the next day adventure, then this hotel is ok. We're not picky. Don't eat breakfast in the hotel for E9.00. Not worth it. The front desk spoke english and helped us out with directions. Wifi was not free. One thing I really liked is that they kept our bags for us after checkout since we had time to walk around Paris before our flight back to Madrid. Around the area, there were a lot of good restaurants, a self-service wash, internet cafe and within walking distance to Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees. We even walked from the Eiffel back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small and musty”
Reviews.Author: xvi0letx
Reviews.Content: Romantic Paris - this hotel was not. I do not understand the reviews on this site. I did not find the location wonderful, or the hotel, wonderful. I suppose you could say the hotel was saved by its proximity to a metro station, but that is about it. We were here for four nights in August and I really wish we would have stayed elsewhere. Our room was very small, and travelling in Europe you become used to this so it wasn't our biggest complaint. The room itself, although tidy, smelled like it hadn't been properly cleaned in a long time. It was very musty and not a welcome place to return to. The shower was teeny and there were no toiletries provided. The wifi was the most expensive we experienced on our trip. 9 euros a day. Although the location was directly above the Argentine station, staying here you really miss out on the quaintness and romance of Paris.The street the hotel is located on is extremely wide (6 lanes, or 4 large lanes) and busy. It is like staying at a roadside hotel. Stay elsewhere. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: IvP72
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small and a bit dated, the bathrooms tiny, but the location is just perfect. We were in Paris for 3 days only and we walked everywhere, the location was so central. Breakfast was excellent, too, with the croissants coming from the yummy bakery next door, I guess. I would stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Somewhat Helpful Staff"”
Reviews.Author: Drew1268
Reviews.Content: I was trapped in Paris during the volcano so my short trip was extended. All 15 nights at this hotel. The rooms were clean, typical smaller European rooms, no air conditioning, the staff was helpful and the location was fantastic. The Argentine stop, Line 1, is only feet from the front door. Line 1 takes passengers from La Defense, to Arc de Triomphe, Louvre, etc... Breakfast was typical, 8 euros for a continental breakfast: coffee, bread, butter, croissant. Best Features: location, good price for Paris Negatives: somewhat small rooms, the walls are a bit thin, no air conditioning Overall, if you are looking for a np frills, European hotel in a great location, and budget friendly for Paris, this is a good choice. In hot weather, I think the rooms may be uncomfortable without air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: cnpab
Reviews.Content: so this hotel we picked because it looked the nicest of all the ones in the price range. glad we picked it if the others would have been worse. small room, but does suffice. no noise from the street unless the window was open. no a/c so it was a bit hot. not "two steps" from the arc du triumph like they say. take the subway to the argentine statiion to get right outside the hotels door. breakfast simple but pricey - grocery store across the street is cheaper. you do have to leave the key there, cant take it with you when you go out for the day. bathroom small, handheld shower head, no shampoo provided. did walk from here to the louvre and notre dame so it is possible .

Reviews.Title: “Good value. No frills.”
Reviews.Author: violet922
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with some friends based on the reviews I had read. It is definitely a budget hotel - no elevator with narrow staircases, breakfast was coffee/croissants/bagette. The rooms were very clean and bed was comfortable. Wifi works and will cost you 9 euros for 24 hrs. Get a room with a shower instead of tub, there's no hook for the shower hose in the tub so you end up holding it the whole time. Rooms facing the front are loud if you want to sleep with the windows open to get ventilation. Rooms facing the courtyard on the top floor would be best. Good bakery right on the corner, Argentine metro stations also at the corner and walking distance to good bistro - Le Hide. If you want to be near the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysee, then this is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Canadianabroad4
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here last summer and it was very nice for the money. The room was clean and quiet (we were on the coutyard) and very convieniently located within walking distance to the Eiffle Tower, the Arc de Triumph, the Champs eleysee and was only a block away from a "hop-on-hop-off bus stop". Clean, good location and excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian spring”
Reviews.Author: thearchitect_8
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay on the hotel site and everything gone well. Small but comfortable hotel with very warm welcoming from the staff. Very clean and quiet (if the room is oriented back yard). Close to few main attractions by foot (Champs Elysee, Eiffel Tower). At 10 m from the subway station Argentine, which assure the connection with almost every location in Paris. The price was good comparing with overall price level around. We stayed 8 days and we were positively impressed by friendly, trustful and helpful staff. The room was small but cozy, recently renovated. We had a very good wi-fi (internet) connection. Still, the TV in the room had only 5 channels; phonic isolation between rooms, not very good. Working temporary or just visiting Paris for a week or more Marmotel Hotel is an excellent choice. We enjoyed very much our stay at this hotel and would be choose again if going again to Paris. Couple from Romania

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: fogeo
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel based on the raves seen here and we were quite disappointed. The one picture and the raves make it seem like this is the best bargain in Paris. Yes, it has a great rate of 87E per night, but thats about it...and I would say thats the only thing great at this hotel. Picture driving on a US interstate and needing to stop at the motel on the side of the road. Thats this. The room was small and dreary. The walls are in major need of paint or repapering. The window didn't shut completely this there was draft. Luckily, we were facing the courtyard so we weren't getting the noise from the street. The bed was flimsy and the comforter musty and I would recommend that for a couple (if you MUST stay here due to budget restrictions) get the room with 2 twin beds which seemed nicer after we peeked in. We were in Room #121. The bathroom was very small and the shower is big enough for a child. I am a slim guy and had trouble. Plus the show head faces the wrong direction, so be prepared to flood the bathroom. The shower itself was moldy. Overall, the ONLY reason to stay here is because it's inexpensive shelter. They have heat and hot water and it's relatively clean. It's no Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: LouieFIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in January 2006 for 3 nights. It's a really really small hotel but it is comfortable, quiet and the staff are very friendly and helpful. It is so near everything and i would definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: magspet
Reviews.Content: Great location for Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysees and Eiffel Tower. Metro immediately outside hotel. Bedrooms comfortable. Staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times. It is a very very small hotel but clean and it could not have a better location! LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION is Excellent! If it's just a bed you need with Paris at your doorstep this is the place to go. If it's luxury you are after then it's not! I will deff go back there! Normally prices are approx 80-90 euro per room per night! Sinead.... IRELAND!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel close to Palais des Congres”
Reviews.Author: Saskatoonmd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located near the Palais de Congres where I was attending a conference. It also was easy to get to from the CDG airport (walking distance from the Avenue Carnot stop of the Air France bus). The room was small but clean, bathroom was tidy and had a tub and they came and cleaned your room and changed your bath towels daily. It was close to the Metro station (Argentine stop) and to the Arc de Triumphe and Champs Elysees. For the convenience and the cost, I would go back to the hotel when I am in Paris.

HotelInfo.Name: Marmotel Etoile
HotelInfo.Address: 34 av. de la Grande Armee, 75017 Paris, France
